value.desc: Date of the component; Either use this property (along with a listener for 'input' event) OR use v-model directive

title.desc: When specified, it overrides the default header title; Makes sense when not in 'minimal' mode

subtitle.desc: When specified, it overrides the default header subtitle; Makes sense when not in 'minimal' mode

emit-immediately.desc: Emit model when user browses month and year too

default-year-month.desc: The default year and month to display (in YYYY/MM format) when model is unfilled (undefined or null)

default-view.desc: The view which will be displayed by default

years-in-month-view.desc: Show the years selector in months view

events.desc: A list of events to highlight on the calendar; If using a function, it receives the date as a String and must return a Boolean (matches or not); If using a function then for best performance, reference it from your scope and do not define it inline

event-color.desc: Color name (from the Quasar Color Palette); If using a function, it receives the date as a String and must return a String (color for the received date); If using a function then for best performance, reference it from your scope and do not define it inline

options.desc: Optionally configure the days that are selectable; If using a function, it receives the date as a String and must return a Boolean (is date acceptable or not); If using a function then for best performance, reference it from your scope and do not define it inline

ranges.desc: Multiple selected days or range of days; The Array can have dates as String or Arrays of with start and end date of the range as String ; If using a function, it receives the date as a String and must return a Boolean (the date is selected or not) or an Object if the date is selected (the keys are: start (Boolean) - date is start of range, end (Boolean) - date is end of range, outline (Boolean) - show the range outlined (else it's filled), color (String) - color to be applied on the range); If using a function then for best performance, reference it from your scope and do not define it inline
examples: :ranges="date => date >= '2018/11/03' && date <= '2018/11/15' ? { range: true, start: date === '2018/11/03', end: date === '2018/11/15', color: 'red' } : false"
:ranges="date => date >= '2018/11/03' && date <= '2018/11/15' ? { range: true, start: date === '2018/11/03', end: date === '2018/11/15', outline: true } : false"

selection-start.desc: Date as String from where the selection starts; If the value is set then selection mode is activated and the next day selection marks the end of the selection range

selection-end.desc: Date as String where the selection ends; If both this value and selection-start are present the selection range is marked as outlined

first-day-of-week.desc: Sets the day of the week that is considered the first day (0 - Sunday, 1 - Monday, ...); This day will show in the left-most column of the calendar

today-btn.desc: Display a button that selects the current day

default.desc: This is where additional buttons can go

reason.desc: Reason of the user interaction (what was picked)

details.desc: Object of properties on the new model

start:selection.desc: Emitted when selection mode is active (ranges prop is an Array or a Function), selection-start prop is not set, and a day is selected; When receiving this event set the selection-start prop to the emitted value to switch to range end selection mode

extend:selection.desc: Emitted when selection mode is active (ranges prop is an Array or a Function), selection-start prop is set, and a day is hovered; When receiving this event set the selection-end prop to display the selection as outlined

selection.desc: An array with the selection-start and hovered day as String, not sorted; If only one day is selected both days are the same

update:selection.desc: Emitted when selection mode is active (ranges prop is an Array or a Function), selection-start prop is set, and a day is selected; When receiving this event change the ranges prop to add the new range

selection.desc: An array with the start and end day of the selection as String, sorted; If only one day is selected both days are the same

setMonthYear.desc: Change current view's month and year; If either of the parameters is missing or invalid it'll be left as it is

offsetCalendar.desc: Increment or decrement calendar view's month or year
